intro: Salacia majumdarii, commonly known as the Indian gooseberry or amla, is a deciduous shrub native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its elliptical, dark green leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that turn from green to orange-red when mature, containing a single seed. Salacia majumdarii is valued for its medicinal properties, particularly for its high vitamin C content and antioxidant activity. It is widely cultivated for both traditional use and commercial purposes.
